text: Is there a nice quick/small code example of a "tight" loop where there's no yield points? I guess a simple long for loop with no memory allocation (everything already preallocated)?

text: that actually is handled gracefully

text:
```julia> while true end
^C^C^C^C^CWARNING: Force throwing a SIGINT
ERROR: ^CInterruptException:
Stacktrace:
 [1] top-level scope
   @ ./REPL[1]:1

julia> ^C```

elements.text:
julia> while true end
^C^C^C^C^CWARNING: Force throwing a SIGINT
ERROR: ^CInterruptException:
Stacktrace:
 [1] top-level scope
   @ ./REPL[1]:1

julia> ^C

text: oh hey yea that isn't so bad lol

elements.text: oh hey yea that isn't so bad lol

text: That's because it's in global scope - `f() = while true end` should work

elements.text: That's because it's in global scope -
f() = while true end
should work

text: Huh, that also works, nevermind me!

elements.text: Huh, that also works, nevermind me!

text: `x = 1; while true; x = x+1; end` is even more graceful

elements.text: x = 1; while true; x = x+1; end
is even more graceful
